page.title: 08POLLOK IN THE PAST GLASGOW
page.content: Most of the original tenants of Pollok refer to the sedate countryside atmosphere of pre-war Pollok and how the estate blended well into the surrounding Pollok Country Estate -the grounds of Pollok House. The residents, on the whole, saw Pollok as a lovely place to live in those days. The houses themselves contained amenities which were lacking in the older slums of Govan and the Gorbals: inside toilet, bath, cupboard space and gardens. Many of the tenants became keen gardeners with large gardens to practice their skills. If any complaint was made regarding the estate it was in relation to the lack of adequate shopping and transport facilities, but the quality of houses were seen as making up for this shortage.
